    (a) Let (Ω,F,P)(\Omega, \mathcal{F}, \mathbb{P})(Ω,F,P) be a probability space and let θ:Ω→Ω\theta: \Omega \rightarrow \Omegaθ:Ω→Ω be measurable.     (b) Let mmm be a probability measure on (R,B)(\mathbb{R}, \mathcal{B})(R,B). Let

    Ω=RN={x=(x1,x2,…):xi∈R for i⩾1}\Omega=\mathbb{R}^{\mathbb{N}}=\left\{x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots\right): x_{i} \in \mathbb{R} \text { for } i \geqslant 1\right\} Ω=RN={x=(x1​,x2​,…):xi​∈R for i⩾1}

    let F\mathcal{F}F be the smallest σ\sigmaσ-field of Ω\OmegaΩ with respect to which the coordinate maps Xn(x)=xnX_{n}(x)=x_{n}Xn​(x)=xn​, for x∈Ω,n⩾1x \in \Omega, n \geqslant 1x∈Ω,n⩾1, are measurable, and let P\mathbb{P}P be the unique probability measure on (Ω,F)(\Omega, \mathcal{F})(Ω,F) satisfying

    P(Xi∈Ai for 1⩽i⩽n)=∏i=1nm(Ai)\mathbb{P}\left(X_{i} \in A_{i} \text { for } 1 \leqslant i \leqslant n\right)=\prod_{i=1}^{n} m\left(A_{i}\right) P(Xi​∈Ai​ for 1⩽i⩽n)=i=1∏n​m(Ai​)
